metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6886 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An error within the "parse_tiff_ifd()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions before 0.18.2 can be exploited to corrupt memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6886` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.5-1
libraw16 - 0.18.5-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: seth-arnold> All non-libraw packages listed here matched portions of the patch; an extensive analysis was not performed.

criterions.comment: darktable package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
kodi package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
libraw package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.5-1').
rawtherapee package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
ufraw package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
